pros: great place to work good management
cons: work can be very tiring when its busy

job_title: Registered Nurse in Thunder Bay, ON
pros: Great coworkers and always lot of job postings available.
cons: High burnout rate amongst nursing staff. Employees are given a difficult time and made to feel blame for disability or injury at work. Staffing ratios are horrible at best - unsafe for patients and staff due to increased likelihood of errors and less time being spent with each patient. Management does little to fix the staffing issues; seem to care more about “filling the beds” than the well-being of their staff and patient care. Management seems to have a “it is what it is” attitude when it comes to the shortages. Overtime almost every shift because there isn’t enough time in the shift to complete all job tasks.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Assistant in Thunder Bay, ON
cons: Very poor training. Missing protocols. Corporate hierarchal mentality. Absent upper management. Constant repercussions for mistakes, and no reward for taking initiative or hard work. Takes 8-10 years to progress to full-time A truly dangerous place to work.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Thunder Bay, ON
pros: Good benefits, fine pay, beautiful hospital, good measures trying to protect staff from violence, some kind management, good education
cons: Ratios lacking, feel like a number, some toxic floors, if you become ill/disable you are made to feel guilty

job_title: Cyclotron Manager in Thunder Bay, ON
pros: Make good experience, make good private pension
cons: Government work, unprofessional setup, too many things to cover, no recognition
Understaffed!!!!! They try to make sure the units are staffed but often we get left with 8-12 patients. almost impossible to get things done on time. Consistently staying late.

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX
cons: No staff appreciation or acknowledgment for loyalty to your job and the commitment to your employer! Patient centred care……..yes amazing patient….that’s because of their amazing staff employed there!!

job_title: Respiratory Therapist in Thunder Bay, ON
pros: There are lots of hours if you want to work lots.  Pay is comparable across all of Ontario but the cost of living is much cheaper in Thunder Bay.  It's a new hospital which is nice.  It's also pretty advanced for being in a small city.
cons: Working short and management not caring about it.  Even though it is a government funded hospital revenue can still be made by doing outpatient procedures, so the priority is still to make revenue at the expence of patient care.
